intro: Senecio micropifolius, commonly known as the little-leaf groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its composite flower heads. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats. Senecio micropifolius is also used in horticulture for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
